metadata.name: Taskkill Symantec Endpoint Protection
metadata.comment: Detects one of the possible scenarios for disabling Symantec Endpoint Protection. Symantec Endpoint Protection antivirus software services incorrectly implement the protected service mechanism. As a result, the NT AUTHORITY/SYSTEM user can execute the taskkill /im command several times ccSvcHst.exe /f, thereby killing the process belonging to the service, and thus shutting down the service.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 2 AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('taskkill')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' /f ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' /im ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('ccsvchst.exe')))
